prompt: <description>**Part 1 Instructions** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a curved side. The object has a rectangular opening on the side. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.044, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.1607. 4. Create the following loops and faces: - For face_1, create loop_1 and loop_2: - loop_1: Draw a circle with a radius of 0.0804 and center at [0.0804, 0.0804]. - loop_2: Draw a circle with a radius of 0.068 and center at [0.0804, 0.0804]. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0618 units. **Part 2 Instructions** Construct a cylindrical object with a slightly tapered top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0564, 0.0124, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.136. 4. Create the following loops and faces: - For face_1, create loop_1 and loop_2: - loop_1: Draw a circle with a radius of 0.068 and center at [0.068, 0.068]. - loop_2: Draw a circle with a radius of 0.0247 and center at [0.068, 0.068]. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0185 units. **Part 3 Instructions** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The object has a central hole that runs through its length. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0681, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the created coordinate system. 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0448. 4. Create the following loops and faces: - For face_1, create loop_1 with 2 arcs and loop_2 with a circle: - loop_1: Draw arc_1 with a start point at [0.0448, 0.0014], midpoint at [0.0, 0.0124], and end point at [0.0448, 0.0233]; draw arc_2 with a start point at [0.0448, 0.0233], midpoint at [0.044, 0.0124], and end point at [0.0448, 0.0014]. - loop_2: Draw a circle with a center at [0.0237, 0.0124] and radius of 0.0124. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.0618 units. **Additional parts can be constructed following the same format.** After constructing all the parts, place them together according to the provided Translation Vector and Euler Angles to form the CAD model of various cylindrical objects with different shapes and sizes. Ensure that the operation values are set correctly during the extrusion process for each part.</description>

Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [*−90.0°*, 0.0°, *−90.0°*] - Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.0, 0.0] 2. Draw the 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system. 3. Create the first face (face_1) by drawing a polygon consisting of 11 lines: - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0161], End Point [0.0161, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.0161, 0.0], End Point [0.6, 0.0] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.6, 0.0], End Point [0.6, 0.5839] - line\\_4: Start Point [0.6, 0.5839], End Point [0.5839, 0.6] - line\\_5: Start Point [0.5839, 0.6], End Point [0.5732, 0.6] - line\\_6: Start Point [0.5732, 0.6], End Point [0.5036, 0.5304] - line\\_7: Start Point [0.5036, 0.5304], End Point [0.5036, 0.3429] - line\\_8: Start Point [0.5036, 0.3429], End Point [0.2571, 0.0964] - line\\_9: Start Point [0.2571, 0.0964], End Point [0.0696, 0.0964] - line\\_10: Start Point [0.0696, 0.0964], End Point [0.0, 0.0268] - line\\_11: Start Point [0.0, 0.0268], End Point [0.0, 0.0161] 4. Scale the 2D sketch using the sketch\\_scale parameter of 0.6. 5. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 6. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction by 0.1875 units and along the opposite direction by 0.1875 units. The sketch scale in this extrusion is 0.6. This will create a slightly tapered top and bottom for the rectangular prism. The final shape is a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and the sides are parallel to each other. The top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The model is centered on a white background. The length, width, and height of the intermediate part and the final shape are: - Length: 0.375 - Width: 0.6 - Height: 0.6 (intermediate part) and 0.75 (final shape)</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole in the Center** The final shape for this part is a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The dimensions are as follows: length - 2 units, width - 1 unit, and height - 0.5 units. The diameter of the cylindrical hole is 0.25 units. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Proceed with creating the 2D sketch for this part on a plane defined by the above coordinate system. The sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1) and a closed loop (loop\\_1), which will be formed by the consecutive lines listed below: * line\\_1: Start Point - [0.0, 0.0], End Point - [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point - [0.75, 0.0], End Point - [0.75, 0.0928] * line\\_3: Start Point - [0.75, 0.0928], End Point - [0.0, 0.0928] * line\\_4: Start Point - [0.0, 0.0928], End Point - [0.0, 0.0] Follow the steps below to transform the 2D sketch into 3D space: 1. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 2. Apply the specified Euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) and translation vector (0.0, 0.0, 0.0) to the scaled 2D sketch. 3. Extrude the sketch using the following parameters: * Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0464 * Extrude depth opposite normal: 0.0 * Sketch scale: 0.75 * Operation: This part corresponds to the "NewBodyFeatureOperation" and can be described as adding material. Finally, please note the following part description details: * Shape: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center, dimensions 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 0.5 units in height, with a diameter of 0.25 units. * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.0464</description>
